dataList.dlg: It is an unfounded rumor that the Association operates only at night; there is no specific time during which we carry out our operations, as they are practicality-based decisions that vary for each target. We also exist in the liminal space between the first light and the early scent of dawn.

Will you not take a moment to imbibe a cup of tea? One must never forget to take breaks, even when swamped by continuous work. By disregarding this simple fact, one may even be forced to let live a life that was not supposed to see tomorrow.
The hour is late. Rest, and do not unnecessarily expose yourself to the night air. ... Faust prefers to see only one type of life at this hour: moving targets.

There is no single correct answer to assassinations. Anything—a sword, an arrow, or even a pebble on the ground—can be an effective tool for the task.
Each branch has simply chosen different weapons that fit their environs better. And for us, it happens to be the bowblade.

One may wonder if the supply is far behind demand in this business... and so does Faust, to a degree. Resentment floods the City like this pouring rain, after all.
... Which is why... it cannot be helped that only a few can carry out the deed.

A straight shot will always strike true. If it hasn't, there can be only one explanation: an excessive, unnecessary attachment to the target.
The target has no face, no history, no family or friends. Those who see them have no place in this business.

Even in the City of inequities, one thing remains fair: death.
Fairness for the beggar who kneels over the wet pavement... and for the loan shark who disparages him from above.
... Both contracts completed.
Bows are not universally applicable tools, of course, and that is why it has a blade as well. An assassin equipped for both ranged and melee combat makes for a rather... formidable opponent.
... Will you listen to the rain, together?
Nock the arrow, pull, loose—it punches through the target, felling it. It is simple, manual labor with very little chance of error.
Has the target been designated?
Uchiokoshi.
Waiting for the right moment.
... Target locked.
Let the pelting rain bury you.
Clean shot through the lung.
Mm...
Bullseye.
Again, fairness is simply a universal concept—even... for me.
Elementary work for an assassin.
... Aimed too high.
Contract fulfilled. While having to resort to melee was regrettable... as always, there were no witnesses.
The pelting raindrops shroud the falling arrows, and they will die in the downpour without knowing what killed them. This is how the eastern branch kills.

Though I infused this bow with my very own blood... neither opportunity nor luck were on my side. As a failure to complete a contract results in death... this shall be my end, for I have slipped to the wrong side of the boundary of death.
